Competitive inhibition of CXCL8 binding to CXCR2 receptor by CXCR2 agonist

body: Cultivate cells endogenously expressing or stably overexpressing CXCR2 \(i.e. HEK293-CXCR2 cells) \(10<sup>5</sup> cells/mL) in a 24-well plate in DMEM medium plus 10% FCS overnight.
Remove the medium and add binding buffer \(medium without FCS).
Put the plate on ice for 10 min.
Add cold agonist, i.e. rMIF or cold CXCL8 \(0 – 1 µM) together with the tracer \(40 pM of 125I -labeled recombinant CXCL8).
Perform equilibrium receptor binding for 90 min at 4 °C.
Remove the medium and wash the cells twice with cold medium.
Harvest the cells by adding 0.5 M NaOH.
Transfer the lysate to a liquid scintillation tube.
Add Aquasafe 500 plus LSC cocktail and mix well.
Determine the cell-bound radioactivity by liquid scintillation counting.
For most agonist-receptor interactions, assume that receptor binding inhibition by agonist \(i.e. rMIF or cold CXCL8) follows a one-site model.
Calculate the EC<sub>50</sub>, K<sub>i</sub> and K<sub>d</sub> values by using the equation of Cheng and Prusoff for heterologous competition experiments, applying the GraphPad software.
